status: public
shortDescription: "One needs to call str to instantiate a str object from a string literal"
shortCorrection: "A string literal represents a str object and can be treated as such"

    id: StringLiteralNoObject

To get a `str` object with a given value (e.g., `'Hello'`), one needs to use `str` to instantiate it, like so: `str('Hello')`.

frontmatter.shortDescription: One needs to call str to instantiate a str object from a string literal
frontmatter.shortCorrection: A string literal represents a str object and can be treated as such
